Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Curved Moving Yellow & Green Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small curved moving yellow square metal platform with green metal edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Circular Green Carpet Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: A circular stone platform with a green carpet going outwards of it.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser's Dark Matter Plant.

Objects.Name: Bowser [Galaxy Reactor]
Objects.Notes: The final Bowser battle, which takes place across three different planets.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Circular Stair Platform
Objects.Notes: A large green and white circular platform with a connector platform extending outwards that makes up the beginning of the long stairs. Unlike other stair platforms, this one does not break.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Bowser Tower Planet
Objects.Notes: The tower planet with rows of slim towers on the sides, on which Bowser awaits the player for battle.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Castle Wall Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet made out of stone floors and ruined dark brick walls featuring a high tower.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Lava Tower Planet
Objects.Notes: A large hollow tower planet with inner walls of lava and many stone platforms, Bullet Bill cannons and Banzai Bill cannons.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Dry Ice Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet entirely of deadly dry ice with a large snowy rock column.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Colossal Hollow Lava Planet Interior
Objects.Notes: A standalone variant of the colossal lava planet's interior.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Colossal Hollow Lava Planet Exterior
Objects.Notes: A standalone version of the galaxy-sized hollow spherical lava planet with holes.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Gravity Panel Wall
Objects.Notes: A blue and pink gravity panel wall seen in the Space Junk blocks section.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Small Rotating Sand Brick Circle
Objects.Notes: A small rotating circle of sand brick blocks.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Large Rotating Sand Brick Circle
Objects.Notes: A large rotating circle of sand brick blocks arranged in a zigzag-like pattern.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Rotating Molten Tar Disk
Objects.Notes: A dark rotating disk of molten tar.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Rotating Green Metal Platforms
Objects.Notes: A set of three bent green metal platforms arranged on a circle facing inwards.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Quicksand Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet entirely of deadly quicksand featuring a few sandy platforms.

Objects.Name: Flipbug
Objects.Notes: A small bug-like enemy that attacks the player in Bee form and runs away from the player under normal conditions.

Objects.Name: Goomba
Objects.Notes: The infamous Goomba enemy that appeared in most Mario games since 1985.

Objects.Name: Big Goomba
Objects.Notes: A big Goomba that appears in Gateway Galaxy and the Supermassive Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Circular Fence
Objects.Notes: A circular fence that is used in The Chimp's challenge in Fluffy Buff Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Mini Goomba
Objects.Notes: A small round Goomba that drops one Coin when jumped on and a Star Bit if spun (always a Coin in SMG1).

Objects.Name: Long Chain
Objects.Notes: A long chain of configurable length.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Small Sinking Platform
Objects.Notes: A small platform that sinks into the lava in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Tide Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet used for the secret Star mission.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Tide
Objects.Notes: The lava tide that periodically shrinks and rises.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Large Sinking Platform
Objects.Notes: A large platform that sinks into the lava in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Dreadnought -- Star Chip Cube Planet
Objects.Notes: The small cube planet that appears on the third star in the Dreadnought Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Battlerock -- Topmaniac's Planet

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Destroyed UFO

Objects.Notes: A small bridge segment that collapses when stepped on.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Rock Columns B

Objects.Notes: A tall blue platform that sinks when stepped on.

Objects.Notes: A blue platform that sinks when stepped on.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Sinking Seesaw Platform

Objects.Notes: A short lava rock used in the background of the Pull Star section.

Objects.Notes: A small lava sparks particle effect.

Objects.Notes: An area that changes lighting when entered.

Objects.Notes: Mario's younger brother who can be talked to.

Objects.Notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Skate Challenge Controller [Shiverburn]
Objects.Notes: A controller used to control The Chimp's skating challenge in Shiverburn Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Deep Dark -- Watermelon Glass Cage Planet
Objects.Notes: A glass planet with orange balls and a watermelon trapped inside. The watermelon grows by smashing these orange balls into it.

Objects.Name: Spawn Point
Objects.Notes: Sets the spawn point for the player at the start of a mission or at Checkpoints in a mission.

Objects.Name: Mario/Luigi
Objects.Notes: Creates a clone of the player that can be controlled. May also be used as the actual spawn point. Should not be used in actual levels!

Objects.Name: Enter New World Cutscene Object Holder
Objects.Notes: A holder that creates and registers several objects that are used in the cutscene where Starship Mario takes off to a new world after collecting a Grand Star.

Objects.Notes: A holder that registers and stores the cutscenes that are used for entering/accessing the Starship Mario through various means.

Objects.Notes: A small disk-shaped planet containing fruit; used on Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Main Planet before Transformation
Objects.Notes: The damaged planet that gets transformed into Starship Mario at the beginning of the game.

Objects.Name: First World Map Entrance Cutscene Object Holder
Objects.Notes: A holder that creates and registers several objects that are used in the cutscene where Starship Mario takes off to World 1 for the first time.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Decorative Chimney
Objects.Notes: The chimney used on Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Rocket Booster
Objects.Notes: A rocket booster used on the back of Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Main Planet
Objects.Notes: The main planet that makes up the Starship Mario.

Objects.Notes: The blue core used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario Steering Wheel
Objects.Notes: The steering wheel used on Starship Mario.

Objects.Notes: A cannon that the player can use to shoot themselves to distant places.

Objects.Notes: A gravity area that attracts the player towards its center point while they are being launched from a cannon.

Objects.Notes: The large interior section where the player has to free a Luma that is trapped inside a crystal.

Objects.Notes: A target for a cannon used on the Dark Matter planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Notes: A rotating object that uses mercator projection for placement. It retrieves a proper model using ShapeModelNo, however, no more models exist for this object.

Objects.Notes: This area forces to display the linked shouting messages when entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.

Objects.Notes: This area forces to display the linked shouting messages when entered.

Objects.Notes: An area that restricts movement to a 2D plane when entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.

- 3 White
1 Short Bush
2 Mushrooms
3 Clover
4 Dead Bush
5 Red Flower
- 0 Red
- 1 White
6 Bubbly Flower
7 Yellow Flower
- 0 Blue
- 1 Yellow
8 Tall Bush

Objects.Notes:
A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different plants. The following shape IDs and colors are available:
0 Tulips
- 0 Pink
- 1 Yellow
- 2 Purple
3 Lily of the Valley

Objects.Name: Decorative Plant C
Objects.Notes:
A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different plants. The following shape IDs and colors are available:
0 Cosmos
1 Round Bush
- 0 Pink
- 1 Red
- 2 White

Objects.Name: Decorative Plant D
Objects.Notes:
A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different plants. The following shape IDs and colors are available:
1 Lily
- 0 Red
- 1 Pink
- 2 Yellow
- 3 White
2 Sunflower

A picture of a Boo or Bomb Boo. The TexChange frame IDs for the different pictures are:

Classes.Notes: A stationary object that will disappear once its SW_B gets triggered. Plays the "Open" animation and destroys itself after that. Plays a short cutscene using a special camera. It also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated once the object kills itself.

Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Once the Move.bck animation has ended, the object will kill itself. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. AnmModelKill specifies the sound effect used when it kills itself. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Once any of the Move animations has ended, the object will kill itself. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. AnmModelKill specifies the sound effect used when it kills itself. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Additionally, the collision will be disabled once it has moved once. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Additionally, the collision will be disabled until it has moved. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model, collision and a Move.bva visibility animation that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. The Move.bva animation's initial frame will be used until the conditions are met. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model, collision and a Reverse.brk animation that will play its Move and Reverse.brk animations once certain conditions are met. The Reverse.brk animation's last frame will be used until the conditions are met. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. AnmModelReverse specifies the sound effect used when the Reverse.brk animations starts playing. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the activation range to the player's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.

Classes.Notes: Remains at a resting position that can be defined by linking a GeneralPos with the name 合体ブロック故郷点 to it. Once the player gets in its range, it will move to its actual position. This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur".

Classes.Notes: Usually not visible but they get activated by Bowser's attacks. Once it appears, it falls down onto ground. Then, it becomes a yellow orb that can be smashed into Bowser. Depending on the encounter number, it can also emit shockwaves.

Obj_arg0.Description: Delay until the rock appears for the first time.
