Classes.Notes: These are usually not visible until Bowser activates them during the final fight. These fly to their actual position and will remain there. The orb can be smashed into Bowser.

Camera.Description: Used when the player stands on the rock.

Classes.Notes: A rock that emits from the ground and breaks into a yellow orb. It can be smashed into KoopaSeals.

Obj_arg1.Description: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).
Obj_arg1.Name: Priority

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies which effect configuration to use.
Obj_arg0.Name: Effect Type

Classes.Notes: Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Rail.Description: Defines the movement path.

Path_arg0.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path.
Path_arg0.Name: Speed

Classes.Notes: A skull that moves around freely or on a set path. It "eats" away parts of objects that are compatible with ClipDrawArea. This enemy cannot be defeated in any way. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

SW_B.Description: If used, this object will be killed once this switch gets activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only be able to emit rings while this switch is activated.

Obj_arg1.Description: The life time of an individual ring before it disappears. Default is 530.
Obj_arg1.Name: Ring Duration

Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the individual rings grow. Default is 12.
Obj_arg0.Name: Ring Speed

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether to use a special model for the shadow or not.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type

Classes.Notes: A variant of a Ring Beamer which periodically emits "spherical" rings that scale along with gravity. The rings will shock the player upon contact. It cannot be destroyed through normal means.
A blowfish enemy that inflates once the player gets in its range. It will then home onto the player and explode after a certain amount of time. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

SW_A.Description: If used, the fruit can only be eaten when this switch is active.

Classes.Notes: A fruit that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Blimp Yoshi. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma to make it swing. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

SW_A.Description: Activated after a Star Ball gets cracked open.

Classes.Notes: If the player touches this object's center while riding a Star Ball, it will pull the Star Ball towards its center and the Star Ball will be cracked open.

Rail.Description: The path that the Star Ball will move on.

Obj_arg1.Description: Deceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 995.
Obj_arg1.Name: Deceleration

Obj_arg0.Description: Acceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 1500.
Obj_arg0.Name: Acceleration

Classes.Notes: An invisible rail for the Star Ball. The Star Ball will automatically start to move along the path once it touches the path's beginning.

Rail.Description: Defines the movement path.

Classes.Notes: A strange enemy whose bouncy springs repel the player when they are using the Boo power-up. It cannot be defeated through any means. It can be frozen by the second player's pointer.

Rail.Description: Specifies the flying path that it will move on.

Obj_arg1.Description: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.
Obj_arg1.Name: Attacking Range

Obj_arg0.Description: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Detection Range

Classes.Notes: A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. If the player comes within its range, it will fly towards them to attack. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze the player if touched, provided that they are not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

Rail.Description: Defines the path that it moves on passively.

Obj_arg1.Description: The range in which it will fall down onto the ground after detecting the player.
Obj_arg1.Name: Attacking Range

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines the movement speed, multiplied by 1000. Default is 600.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Obj_arg2.Description: If enabled, it won't spawn any Star Bits after being defeated.
Obj_arg2.Name: Spawn no Star Bits?

Classes.Notes: A stone block enemy that moves on a fixed path. Once it sees the player, it will move towards them to fall down on them. Once it lies on the ground, the weak point on its back can be Ground Pounded. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma. It will spawn 7 Star Bits if defeated.

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the camera vector register. Occupies two cameras.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Starting Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the intro cutscene if the switch gets activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after defeating the boss.

Classes.Notes:
A large stone block boss. He can summon Whimps that will try to attack the player like Whomps do. The boss himself can defeat those smaller blocks by crushing them. Like his smaller counterparts, this boss will try to fall onto the player to attack them. He can also attack using shockwaves that appear when he jumps. When he's lying on ground, the player can Ground Pound the weak spot on its back to damage him. After hitting the boss three times, he will be defeated. He always spawns a Power Star.
He uses two GeneralPos. バッタンキング基準位置 is used as his position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position the player after the battle. Several messages are also required. BattanKing000 specifies the introduction text. BattanKing001 specifies the text after defeating him. Lastly, the actual cutscenes have to be specified as well: バッタンキング登場 for the opening and バッタンキングダウン for the outro.
A stretchy plant with spikes that will lunge onto the player to damage them. Cannot be defeated, however, they can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit at them.

Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.
Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length

Rail.Description: Specifies the movement path. Used by MapPartsRailMover and MapPartsRailPosture.

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the rotation's speed.
Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Speed

Classes.Notes: A rotating platform that can be stood on using the Bee power-up. If the player does not have this power-up and touches the platform, it will temporarily disappear.
A bouncy berry that can be bounced off with the Bee power-up. If touched by the player while they don't have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds.
If the player is using the Bee power-up and is inside this area, it will make them fly a longer distance than usual.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning

Classes.Notes: A small robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. However, it can be defeated using Spin Attacks. If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It can be defeated by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

SW_B.Description: If activated, the spawner will be deactivated. Also kills any Spring and Spike Topman in SMG2.

Obj_arg3.Description: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.
Obj_arg3.Name: Number of Topman

Obj_arg2.Description: The delay until the first spawn occurs.
Obj_arg2.Name: Activation Delay

Classes.Notes: A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will be defeated immediately.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning

Classes.Notes: A rotating robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. If the player touches its spiky head, they will take damage. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will be defeated immediately.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning

Camera.Description: Used when player gets bounced off.

Classes.Notes: A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which the player can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called BegomanSpringHide, it will remain in the ground until the player gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time.

DemoCast.Description: Special cutscene used before the actual boss fight begins.

Camera.Description: Used during the intro, midway cutscene and ending.

Classes.Notes: A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses a GeneralPos with the name プレイヤーデモ位置（ベリードラゴン戦） to position the player during the intro. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod. See BellyDragonLv1Zone for a better look inside the cutscene.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will enter the second folding state.

SW_A.Description: If activated, it will enter the first folding state.

Classes.Notes: A special planet that can fold two times. Each state also has a separate collision mesh that gets loaded in. Usually, the planet will be in its unfolded state. SW_A and SW_B are used to fold it.

Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default 2000.
Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the clipping type.
Obj_arg3.Name: Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Used for movement after the item appears. Broken in SMG2.

Classes.Notes: An item that grants the player the Invincibility power-up when collected.

Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.
Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the clipping type.
Obj_arg3.Name: Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Used for movement after the item appears. Broken in SMG2.

Classes.Notes: An item that increases the player's health to 6 when collected. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.
Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the clipping type.
Obj_arg3.Name: Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Used for movement after the item appears. Broken in SMG2.

Classes.Notes: An item that grants the player an extra life when collected. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

SW_B.Description: Invalidates this area if this switch gets activated. However, this only works in "TwisterTowerGalaxy".

Obj_arg1.Description: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 0. ChangeBgmState index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 2. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Argument 1

Obj_arg0.Description: The music change type.
Obj_arg0.Name: Change Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Sets how music changes are handled during Comet missions.

Values.Notes: Music change is ignored during Comet
Music change is enforced during Comet

Obj_arg3.Name: Comet Music Type

Obj_arg2.Description: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 1. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 2.
Obj_arg2.Name: Argument 2

Classes.Notes: Changes the background music using the stage's music information in StageBgmInfo. Supports several different changing modes.

Obj_arg1.Description: The music's volume multiplied by 100.
Obj_arg1.Name: Volume

Obj_arg0.Description: The music's fade time in frames. Default is 90.
Obj_arg0.Name: Fade Time

Classes.Notes: When the player enters this area, the music's volume will be changed. The volume resets if the player leaves the area again.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: The player's movement speed, multiplied by 100. Default is 100.
Obj_arg1.Name: Speed

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines the wind gust's length. Default is 4000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Wind Length

Classes.Notes: A fan object that creates a gust of wind that can push Blimp Yoshi and the player if they use the Boo power-up. If this is placed in TeresaMario2DGalaxy, it will use a slightly different sound effect.

SW_B.Description: If used, the fan will not rotate if the switch is not actived.

Classes.Notes: A generic, rotating fan. It does not create a wind gust unlike BigFan.

SW_B.Description: Makes the object stop while the switch is not active.

SW_A.Description: Makes the object move while the switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Rail.Description: The path that the platform moves on. Used by MapPartsRailMover.

Classes.Notes: A platform that moves on a path and teleports back to the beginning after it has reached the end. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.
A useless area that has no actual effect in-game.

Group.Description: If any of the group members gets frozen by Player 2, all of them will stop moving.

Rail.Description: Defines the movement path.

Point_arg0.Description: Defines the time in frames before the object will move again.
Point_arg0.Name: Waiting Time

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the movement speed.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow type.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type

Classes.Notes: A large electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

Group.Description: If any of the group members gets frozen by Player 2, all of them will stop moving.

Rail.Description: Defines the movement path.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the side direction.
Obj_arg1.Name: Side Type

Point_arg0.Description: Defines the time in frames before the object will move again.
Point_arg0.Name: Waiting Time

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the movement speed.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the gravity calculation type.

Values.Notes: Negated gravity is up. Always calculate gravity
Negated gravity is up. Calculate gravity once

Obj_arg3.Name: Gravity Type

Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow type.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type

Classes.Notes: A small electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

SW_A.Description: If triggered, it disappears immediately.

DemoCast.Description: Disappears if the action is activated.

Obj_arg0.Description: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Model Scale

Camera.Description: Used when the player gets sucked in by it.

Classes.Notes: A black hole that sucks in the player and some compatible objects if they enter its range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0.

Obj_arg1.Description: Brightness filter level. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 255.
Obj_arg1.Name: Threshold

Obj_arg0.Description: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.
Obj_arg0.Name: Intensity

Obj_arg3.Description: Secondary intensity argument.
Obj_arg3.Name: Intensity 2

Obj_arg2.Description: Primary intensity argument.
Obj_arg2.Name: Intensity 1

Classes.Notes: An area that applies bloom effects to compatible objects inside it. For this, the object needs a Bloom.arc model file. However, not all objects support this natively.

An unused class that does not work properly due to a programming error. Normally, it is meant to grow if it's in Bulb Yoshi's light range. This would make a Star Bit appear as well. However, the developers messed up a nerve check, so this effect is never triggered. If it's outside Bulb Yoshi's light, however, it will wither again.

Rail.Description: Specifies the optional path that it can move on.

Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object, the other Blue Star Chips and their controller.
Obj_arg0.Name: Blue Chip Group ID

Obj_arg3.Description: If true, the chip will be placed inside an Air Bubble.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the shadow's drop direction will use the object's gravity vector instead of calculating the shadow direction once.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Calculation

Obj_arg4.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 2000.
Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes: A collectable blue chip. Usually five of these are linked together by a BlueChipGroup to trigger a switch to spawn another object, for example a Pull Star. It's usually stationary but it can move on a path as well.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when all linked Blue Star Chips have been collected.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Blue Star Chips will disappear after activating its SW_APPEAR. Default is -1, which makes the objects appear indefinitely.
Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit

Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object and its Blue Star Chips.
Obj_arg0.Name: Blue Chip Group ID

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies what to do with SW_A and the individual chips after reloading the scene, for example after a death.

Values.Notes: Player has to collect items again after reloading the scene
Reactivates SW_A and destroys chips after reloading the scene

Obj_arg3.Name: Re-activation Type

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the range from this object that the player has to be within for the counter layout to be displayed. Default is 2000.
Obj_arg2.Name: Counter Display Range

Classes.Notes: Controls a group of Blue Star Chips (BlueChip) and activates SW_A once all of them have been collected. It is recommended to have five Blue Star Chips per group. The group for this object and the individual Blue Star Chips has to be specified using Obj_arg0. This controller is also responsible for displaying the counter layout at the top of the screen.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will not rotate or move on its path while this switch is activated.

DemoCast.Description: Appears if the action is activated.

Rail.Description: Used for MapPartsRailMover movement.

Classes.Notes: Planet-like objects that feature a large Pull Star inside them. The player can use the pointer on the Pull Star to make it attract them. UFOBlueStarCupsule is hardcoded to use a lower target radius.
If the player stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Pull Stars.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will fly away from Mario.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Rail.Description: The path that it flies on.

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, it will fly far above the actual path. Also disables clipping.
Obj_arg0.Name: Flies Higher?

Classes.Notes: A bird enemy that flies on a path. If the player gets near it, it will drop a bomb that explodes after some seconds. It can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit on it. Can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

SW_A.Description: If not activated, it won't pursue Mario and will walk around passively. It will still be able to fuse when touched, though.

Obj_arg1.Description: The explosion's radius. Default 500.0f
Obj_arg1.Name: Explosion Range

Obj_arg0.Description: The time until the bomb explodes. Default 600.
Obj_arg0.Name: Countdown

Classes.Notes: A bomb or bomb-like enemy, depending on the object's name. Bomb creates a simple bomb that can be picked up and thrown whereas BombHei creates the actual enemy that will walk around and fuse if it sees the player. It can be stunned and picked up after using a Spin Attack.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only dispense objects while this switch is activated.

Obj_arg2.Description: Unknown
Obj_arg2.Name: Unknown

Classes.Notes: A dispenser that releases bombs or Bob-ombs. If the object is named BombLauncher, it creates bombs whereas it creates Bob-ombs when it's called BombHeiLauncher. There can only be one bomb or Bob-omb at once.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

Classes.Notes: A friendly Bob-omb NPC that can be talked to.

Obj_arg1.Description: Disables respawning after it dies.
Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Respawning?

Classes.Notes: A Boo variant that can be swung around using its tongue. It can be smashed into several objects to damage or destroy them. If the player swings it around and does not get rid of it after some time, it will blink red and explode.

SW_A.Description: Remains stationary if the switch is not activated.

Rail.Description: The path points to jump between.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how items should be spawned.
Obj_arg1.Name: Item Type

Obj_arg0.Description: The delay until it starts jumping around.
Obj_arg0.Name: Starting Delay

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.
Obj_arg3.Name: Connect to MapObj?

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will always cycle through all of its points instead of hopping between the two points closest to the player.
Obj_arg2.Name: Pass All Points?

Classes.Notes: A Koopa Troopa that throws boomerangs to attack the player. These boomerangs can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives the player an advantage to attack it. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma as well.

SW_A.Description: Makes it Ground Poundable once activated.

Rail.Description: Specifies the points that she will look at move to randomly.

Classes.Notes:
A dinosaur-like boss that sleeps until the player Ground Pounds the weak spot on her belly. Excluding the first time, the player has to damage her three times. Starting the second phase, she will shoot fire balls that can temporarily cover manhole grates in lava. During the last phase, she will turn red and move faster. She is supposed to be placed on a disk-like planet as she can freely walk around such planets and change sides.
She uses two GeneralPos. ボスブッスン位置 is used as her position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position the player after the battle. She always spawns a Power Star which needs to be set up in the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register cameras.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: The path it moves on when throwing Spinys.

Classes.Notes:
A large variant of a Lakitu who wears glasses and rides on a purple cloud. He throws Spinies at the player and may also use thunderbolts to attack them. When he throws Spinies, he will be moving on a path whereas he moves between two separate points when using the thunderbolt attack. He can be damaged by thrown Shells or Yoshi projectiles. After dealing three hits, he will spawn a Power Star. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file.
This object also uses several GeneralPos. ジュゲム突進点１ and ジュゲム突進点２ are used as the right and left points that it moves between when using the thunderbolt attack. カメラ基準点 is used as the orientation point that the camera will look at most of the time. ボスジュゲムデモ位置 defines the position of the intro cutscene. ボスジュゲムダウンデモ位置 defines the position of the defeated cutscene.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the clouds turn to gray. If deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

Classes.Notes: A set of clouds. If SW_A is triggered, they will turn gray. In this state, they will deal electric damage to the player and compatible enemies. Once the switch is deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector and matrix register cameras.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: Its main movement path that it flies and walks on.

Camera.Description: Used when falling onto the ground.

Classes.Notes: A large bug-like boss that can be damaged by Ground Pounding the weak spot on its back. It needs to be damaged three times. During the first phase, it moves slowly on the ground. After taking the first hit, it starts flying. And in the last phase, its skin turns red and it will make aggressive turns while it flies. While it flies, it will periodically drop explosive bombs that can hurt the player. After it is defeated, it will spawn a Power Star, which also requires changes to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg7.Description: The item that is displayed inside the cage. 5 Star Bits and Power Stars can be spawned directly.
Obj_arg7.Name: Item Type

SW_B.Description: Gets deactivated after destroying this object.

Obj_arg6.Description: The color frame of the Toad or Luma contained inside the cage.
Obj_arg6.Name: Toad/Luma Color

SW_A.Description: Registered to be set but never used.

Group.Description: Used to group several trash piles for use with the Gearmo minigame.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, the rotation will not be affected by gravity.
Obj_arg1.Name: Ignore Gravity?

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after destroying this object.

Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the cage rotates. Negative values invert the direction.
Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Speed

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, it will play the "riddle solved" jingle when destroyed.
Obj_arg3.Name: Play Riddle SFX?

Obj_arg2.Description: When enabled, SW_DEAD will be activated immediately instead of having to wait for the breaking animation to finish.
Obj_arg2.Name: Delay SW_DEAD activation?

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after destroying it. Requires Obj_arg7 to be set to 7.

Classes.Notes: A destroyable obstacle that can be destroyed using Koopa Shells, Yoshi's projectiles or any enemy attack except enemy fire damage. Most of its variants can contain an item. Except for Star Bits and Power Stars, the items are only cosmetic. If the item is set to Power Star, the object also requires a proper setup in the galaxy's Scenario file. When BreakableCageL gets destroyed, it will always play the "riddle solved" jingle.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Classes.Notes: Draws a bright sun-like sphere in the background that moves with the camera's position. If the player is inside a LensFlareArea, the lens flare effect will be rendered around the sun.

SW_A.Description: Activated after the request is fulfilled.

Obj_arg0.Description: Intended for a check whose result is never used for anything.
Obj_arg0.Name: Useless

Classes.Notes: This registers and controls the enemies requested by a CareTakerHunter. This object is usually linked to a CareTakerHunter using GeneratorId. Otherwise, it's useless on its own. The requested enemies can be attached to this object by setting their GeneratorId to this object's l_id. Supported enemies are Kuribo, TogeBegomanLauncher, BegomanLauncher and BegomanBabyLauncher. If a requested enemy is in this object's sensor range, it will notify the linked CareTakerHunter.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Classes.Notes: A dinosaur enemy that moves around on a path. It can be defeated by stomping on its belly. It damages the player upon contact. The Orange Luma can freeze its movement.

Obj_arg1.Description: Does not spawn a Star Bit when touched.
Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Star Bits?

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the BRK color frame.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color

Classes.Notes: A decorative butterfly. It can spawn a Star Bit when touched with the pointer. If the player is sleeping near a butterfly, it will eventually land on their nose.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines its movement speed. Default is 3.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Classes.Notes: An enemy that moves on a set path. If no path is specified, it will remain in place.
A simple object that damages the player and compatible objects, such as SandBirdParts objects.
An area that removes the Bee power-up from the player if they are inside this area.

SW_A.Description: If used, the flame won't appear until Mario shoots a Fire Ball at it. Then, this switch will be activated.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will be connected to the collision below. This makes it move along moving objects, for example.
Obj_arg1.Name: Attach to Collision?

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the item to be spawned after putting out the fire.
Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type

Classes.Notes: A torch with a flame that can burn the player upon contact. Usually, the flame can be put out using a Spin Attack to make an item appear, however, the flame of CandlestandIceVolcano cannot be put out. Said variant may also appear without a flame if it uses a SW_A. Instead, the player can use Fire Balls to lit the fire and activate the switch. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg7.Description: Tries to load the model CapsuleCageNoKeyHole if enabled. This model does not exist anymore, though.
Obj_arg7.Name: Use Alternate Model?

SW_B.Description: If activated, the cage will be opened.

Obj_arg6.Description: If set, it will play the STM_STAR_CHANCE_3 music once it gets opened.
Obj_arg6.Name: Play Star Chance Music?

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after the cage disappears.

Camera.Description: Used when the cage gets opened.

Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after the cage gets opened.
Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type

Classes.Notes: A locked cage that can be opened by activating its SW_B switch. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg1.Description: The number of debris to be generated. Stops generation after the requested amount has appeared. If set to -1, it will keep spawning more debris.
Obj_arg1.Name: Debris Count

Obj_arg0.Description: Time between spawns in frames.
Obj_arg0.Name: Delay

Classes.Notes: Periodically spawns collapsing debris that can damage the player upon contact. The individual debris can be frozen by the Orange Luma. For each spawn, a random debris model gets loaded. These models are called CaveInPartsBig, CaveInPartsMiddle and CaveInPartsSmall.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will emit particles only if this switch is activated.

Group.Description: Registers effects of the same object type, but the group is never used for anything.

DemoCast.Description: If used, it will start functioning once its cutscene action gets triggered. In SMG2, it will stop functioning if Obj_arg0 is set.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the object will stop functioning if the cutscene action gets triggered.
Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?

Classes.Notes: An unfinished particles effect that works like EffectObjR500F50. It has a clipping radius of 500 and a far clipping distance of 50. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList. The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

If the player attempts to exit this area while using the Flying power-up, they will be restricted to move inside the area only. The flying effect will be cancelled when the player reaches the edge of this area.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes:
A generic map object that will turn invisible if the camera passes it. For this, it loads a separate model with the suffix Alpha. The Alpha model uses two animations. Normal.brk, which is used for the visible state, and Alpha.brk, which is used to make the model fade out of existence.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: Opens the door while the switch is activated.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Classes.Notes: The room where the player can change between Mario and Luigi. Before the player defeats Bowser in Bowser's Galaxy Generator, the object will remain in a deactivated state. After this event, it will become usable. In order to open the door, its SW_A needs to be activated. If it is registered to a cutscene called チェンジルームからスタート, it can use a special nerve action which cause the player to jump out.

An invisible point that teleports the player to another position, just like a Warp Pipe. However, this works in one way only. The destination point needs to be specified using a GeneralPos called マリオ顔惑星煙突出口.

Rail.Description: Defines the path that it moves on.

Obj_arg1.Description: The rate at which the train moves. Default is 5.
Obj_arg1.Name: Speed

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of train parts except the main car that should be created. Default is 3.
Obj_arg0.Name: Train Segments

Classes.Notes: A toy train that consists of at least one segment. It moves on a set path and it randomly creates a whistling sound effect. The individual segments are also affected by gravity, so they will rotate accordingly.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the movement speed. Default is 3.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Classes.Notes: A black spiky blob-like enemy that remains stationary or moves on a path. It can be defeated by most of the player's attacks. It damages the player upon contact. The Orange Luma can freeze its movement.

Obj_arg7.Description: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.
Obj_arg7.Name: Inside Bubble?

SW_B.Description: Kills all Coins if this switch gets activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting all Coins.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. If its special action functor gets triggered, all Coins will appear.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Coins will disappear again. Default is -1, which makes the Coins appear indefinitely.
Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be created. Default is 8.
Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins

Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.
Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Calculation

Obj_arg2.Description: The distance that specifies how far to spread the Coins from the center. Default is 200.
Obj_arg2.Name: Radius

Obj_arg4.Description: Defines how to to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coin to the collision below in SMG2.

Values.Notes: Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity
Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity
Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

Obj_arg4.Name: Pose Type

Classes.Notes: Creates a group of Coins (CircleCoinGroup) or Purple Coins (CirclePurpleCoinGroup) that are arranged in a circle. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files.

An invisible volume that hides parts of compatible objects, for example SimpleClipPartsObj, that are inside the volume. However, this effect requires an instance of FallOutFieldDraw (SMG1) or ClipDrawArea (SMG2) placed in the level in order to function properly.

An area that creates and enables Matter Splatter effects for compatible objects (SimpleClipPartsObj, etc.) when entered by the player. This also creates an instance of FallOutFieldDraw, which is needed to render the clipped objects. The effect will not work if the player is outside a ClipDrawArea. Furthermore, if StarLightReceiver objects, such as PunchingKinoko or BloomFlower, are placed inside this area, special behavior will be enabled for them. See the respective objects for more information.
A controller that renders Matter Splatter surfaces (ClipArea) with a yellow glowing overlay. However, this effect does not work without a code patch as its rendering is disabled by default.

SW_B.Description: Gets deactivated if the player is inside a ClipArea and gets activated when the player is outside a ClipArea.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated if the player is inside a ClipArea and gets deactivated when the player is outside a ClipArea.

Classes.Notes: A controller that toggles its SW_A and SW_B switches depending on whether the player is inside a ClipArea or not.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Classes.Notes: A simple object with a model and collision. Very limited in its functionality compared to other simple map object classes. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_B.Description: If used, the platform will move on its path while this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Classes.Notes: A cloud platform that can be stood on using the Bee or Cloud power-ups. If the player does not have any of these two power-ups and steps on the platform, it will temporarily disappear. When Ground Pounded, it will temporarily disappear as well, no matter what power-up is currently active. The platform remains stationary or moves on a path.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will continue rolling while it is colliding with other coconuts.
Obj_arg1.Name: Continue Rolling?

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will use a spherical shadow instead of a cylindrical volume.
Obj_arg0.Name: Use Spherical Shadow?

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will reappear at its original position once it gets out of view.
Obj_arg2.Name: Reset When Out of View?

Classes.Notes: A coconut that can be flung into various obstacles and enemies by the player or the Orange Luma in SMG2. It can be kicked across the map. Once the player collects 9999 Star Bits in a save file, all coconuts will turn into watermelons. It will always reappear at its original position if gets destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it enables DemoSimpleCast functionality.
Obj_arg0.Name: Use DemoSimpleCast?

Classes.Notes: Creates a group of animated palm tree leaves with collision. If the player Ground Pounds one of the leaves, it will swing at a faster rate.

Obj_arg0.Description: The valid range in which it appears from the ground. Default is 1800.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Range

Classes.Notes: A spiky cactus enemy that damages the player upon contact. It can be stunned using coconuts or the Rainbow power-up. Goombas and Topman enemies can stun it as well. On the other hand, it can stomp Goombas. After stunning it, its vulnerable head remains, which can be destroyed using most of the player's attacks. It can be scaled as well. It can be frozen by the second player's pointer.

Obj_arg7.Description: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.
Obj_arg7.Name: Inside Bubble?

SW_B.Description: Kills the Coin if this switch gets activated.

Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.
Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Calculation

Obj_arg4.Description: Defines how to to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coin to the collision below in SMG2.

Values.Notes: Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity
Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity
Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

Obj_arg4.Name: Pose Type

Classes.Notes: One of the game's main collectibles. There are two variants: Coins (Coin) and Purple Coins (PurpleCoin). Normal Coins can restore one health point if collected by the player. Purple Coins do not restore health, though. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files. Normal Coins won't appear during Daredevil (Dark) Comets. Both variants can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. If they are stored inside a bubble, they will also restore the player's air when underwater. Coins will spin slower when placed underwater.

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be spawned. Default is 8.
Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins

Classes.Notes: A point in space where the requested number of Coins will be spawned after activating its SW_APPEAR switch.

SW_B.Description: Causes all Coins to disappear immediately once this switch gets activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting all connected Coins.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the timer during which the Coins will be visible. Coins will appear indefinitely if set to -1. Default is -1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Timer

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated if not all Coins have been collected in time.

Classes.Notes: Creates a set of Coins that will appear once this object's SW_APPEAR gets triggered. These Coins will only be collectable for the specified period of time or indefinitely (Obj_arg0). If the player collects all linked Coins in time, they will be rewarded with a 1-Up. The actual Coin objects need to be linked to this object by setting their GeneratorId's to this object's l_id. Compatible Coin objects are CircleCoinGroup and RailCoin.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how long it takes for the tile to disappear after being stepped on. Default is 140 frames.
Obj_arg0.Name: Shrinking Time

Classes.Notes: A framed platform that will shrink down and disappear after the player stepped on it. The shrinking can be paused using the second player's pointer. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Classes.Notes: A platform that moves on a set path and disappears after reaching the end. Once it disappears, it will reappear at the start after a few seconds. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the Silver Stars combine.

DemoCast.Description: Makes the Power Star appear if 集めチコスター出現 action gets triggered.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Appears after the Silver Stars combine. If this is part of a cutscene, it will appear when the 集めチコスター出現 part gets executed.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the Silver Stars will combine at this object's position. Otherwise, they will combine above the player.
Obj_arg0.Name: Combine at Controller's Position?

Camera.Description: Used when the individual Silver Stars combine.

Classes.Notes: A controller that registers and keeps track of Silver Stars. If the player has collected all Silver Stars, it will spawn a Power Star. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file. The Silver Stars need to be linked to this object using Obj_ID (SMG1) or GeneratorId (SMG2). See StrayTico for the individual Silver Stars.

Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the collision cannot be bypassed using the Boo power-up.
Obj_arg1.Name: Prevent Boo Power-Up?

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, the pushing force will be disabled for all surfaces, so that only the jumpable faces (Obj_arg3) can be interacted with.
Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Pushing?

Obj_arg3.Description: Bitfield that toggles what faces of the collision can be stood on or jumped off. The values can be combined by adding them together. Default is 1, which enables all.
Obj_arg3.Name: Active Faces

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how far the pushing extents reach from every face. Default is 0, which makes it possible to touch the actual collision.
Obj_arg2.Name: Push Radius

Classes.Notes: An invisible collision polygon that is contained inside the area. Only the player can interact with the collision. If not disabled through any means, the collision can be traversed using the Boo power-up. There are several Obj_args that can be used to define how the player interacts with the collision.
An area that, when entered, forces the player to run in a straight line. The player will jump as high as the third jump of a Triple Jump.
An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Spring power-up. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.
An area that, when entered, prevents the player from using the Spin Attack. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.
An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Invincibility power-up. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

DemoCast.Description: The cutscene that it belongs to. Expected to be called コンプリートエンディング.

Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear during the ending cutscene in the Comet Observatory's library. The cutscene that it tries to register to has to be called コンプリートエンディング. The individual objects with their model name and object name are RosettaReading (デモ用ロゼッタ), RosettaChair (デモ用ロゼッタ椅子), TicoBaby (デモ用ベビチコ) and MarioCap or LuigiCap (デモ用マリオ帽子). It has a special nerve action for cutscenes which makes all objects appear when triggered. The GeneralPos コンプリートエンディングデモ基準点 marks the reference point for the objects.

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, it will spawn a single Coin when destroyed.
Obj_arg0.Name: Spawn Coin?

Classes.Notes: A destroyable light post that spawns three Star Bits when destroyed. This can be done by using a Spin Attack, the Spin Drill, the Rock power-up or by shooting a Star Bit at it. Can be targeted and destroyed by the Orange Luma as well.

SW_B.Description: Needs to be activated after collecting all flowers in order to make the Power Star spawn.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after all plants have appeared.

Classes.Notes: Creates and registers plant objects (PlantA, PlantB, PlantC, PlantD) and activates a switch once all of the plant objects have appeared. The individual plant objects have to be assigned to this object by setting their GeneratorId to this object's l_id. If the object is called CountFlowerPowerStar, it can also spawn a Power Star once all plants have appeared and its SW_B got activated. This requires edits to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Rail.Description: Specifies the flower's stem that can be climbed.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the horizontal flinging speed. Default is 25.
Obj_arg1.Name: Horizontal Speed

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how much the plant bends when grabbed by the player. Default is 100.
Obj_arg0.Name: Normal Bending Factor

Camera.Description: Used when touching or climbing the flower.

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how much the plant bends when grabbed with the Bee power-up. Default is -1 which causes Obj_arg0 to be used instead.
Obj_arg3.Name: Bee Bending Factor

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the vertical flinging speed. Default is 40.
Obj_arg2.Name: Vertical Speed

Classes.Notes: A large, usually curved, flower that the player can swing along by shaking the Wiimote. Once the player reaches the end of the flower, it will cause them to jump off. The speed and bending are configurable.
An object with a model and collision that tilts towards the side that the player stands on.

Obj_arg7.Description: The item that is displayed inside the cage. 1 Coin, 5 Star Bits and Power Stars can be spawned directly. It will play special sound effects if it contains a Toad or a Luma.
Obj_arg7.Name: Item Type

Obj_arg6.Description: The color frame of the Toad or Luma contained inside the cage.
Obj_arg6.Name: Toad/Luma Color

SW_A.Description: Forces the Crystal to be destroyed once this switch gets activated.

Group.Description: Registers crystals of the same object type, but the group is never used for anything.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, it will play the "riddle solved" jingle when destroyed.
Obj_arg1.Name: Play Riddle SFX?

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated once it is destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the crystals that remain after destroying it will be hidden.
Obj_arg0.Name: Hide Remains?

Obj_arg3.Description: If set, it will simply disappear if SW_A gets activated while it is out of view.
Obj_arg3.Name: SW_A Disappear?

Obj_arg2.Description: Enables collision binding if set.
Obj_arg2.Name: Use Binder?

Obj_arg4.Description: Determines if the crystal falls when it spawns via SW_APPEAR.
Obj_arg4.Name: Is Falling?

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after destroying it. It requires Obj_arg7 to be set to 7.

Classes.Notes: A destroyable crystal that can contain a variety of different items. Except for Coins, Star Bits and Power Stars (SMG2 only), the items are only cosmetic. If the item is set to Power Star, the object also requires a proper setup in the galaxy's Scenario file. The crystal can be destroyed with most of the player's attacks as well as all enemy attacks. If a crystal object is placed inside a PlaneCollisionCube area, it will always load the CrystalCage2D model instead.

Group.Description: Registers crystals of the same object type, but the group is never used for anything.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated once it is destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: The scenario ID of the Power Star to be spawned. -1 will look for the first scenario entry.
Obj_arg0.Name: Power Star ID

Classes.Notes: A large crystal with a Power Star trapped inside that requires two hits with a Spin Attack to be destroyed. The Power Star spawns once the crystal gets destroyed. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg1.Description: The game reads this value but never uses it. This is only read if Obj_arg0 is set.
Obj_arg1.Name: Useless

Obj_arg0.Description: Plays an animation called Move if enabled. No actual object of this class has such animations, so it's never used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Play "Move" Animation?

Obj_arg3.Description: The number of Star Bits to spawn after destroying it. Obj_arg2 has to be set to -1. Default is 5.
Obj_arg3.Name: Number of Star Bits

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies what kind of item to spawn after destroying it.
Obj_arg2.Name: Item Type

Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the remaining broken pieces will be hidden.
Obj_arg4.Name: Hide Broken Pieces?

Classes.Notes: An opaque crystal that can be destroyed with a Spin Attack, Yoshi's projectiles, the Spin Drill, a Koopa Shell or the Orange Luma as well as any enemy attack. It may reward the player with some items. Loads a separate model for the breaking animation.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after hitting the switch.

Obj_arg0.Description: How long it will rotate and keep the switch activated when hit. Useless in SMG1 due to unfinished coding.
Obj_arg0.Name: Activation Time

Classes.Notes: An unfinished crystal-like switch that can be hit using most of the player's attacks. Once hit, it will start spinning and it will activate its SW_A switch.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies what camera setup to use after entering this area.
Obj_arg0.Name: Camera ID

Obj_arg3.Description: Bitfield of contexts that are affected by camera changes through this area. In SMG2, these values can be combined by adding the values together. If set to 0, the game will set this value to 1. In SMG1, this setting is much more complicated: The lower four bits can be used to specify a single category (0 = Normal, 1 = Underwater, ...). These bits will be ignored if bit 4 or higher is set. These upper bits then correspond to be bitmask values (16 = Normal, 32 = Underwater, ...).
Obj_arg3.Name: Affected Contexts

Obj_arg2.Description: The camera area with the highest priority and requested categories will take effect.
Obj_arg2.Name: Priority

Classes.Notes: An area that changes the current camera once the player enters this area. The actual camera parameters are specified in the zone's CameraParam.bcam. The corresponding camera ID label is generated using the printf format string c:%04x. For example, if your camera area has an Obj_arg0 of 15, the corresponding ID label would be c:000f. This can also be restricted to take effect only under different circumstances (Obj_arg3).

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the required amount of time inside this area has passed.

Obj_arg0.Description: The required number of time frames to spend inside this area.
Obj_arg0.Name: Counter

Classes.Notes: An area that activates its SW_A switch if the player has spent the total requested number of time frames inside this area.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after Ground Pounding the top.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes: A set of cymbal platforms with separate collision meshes. The top one can be moved like a seesaw platform. A SW_A can be activated by Ground Pounding the top. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Classes.Notes: A flower-like enemy that moves around in a twirling motion. They attack by turning into a flower that spins around rapidly. If no path is assigned, it will only spin in place. It can be defeated by all of the player's attacks. Furthermore, it can be eaten by Yoshi and frozen by the Orange Luma. Shooting a Star Bit at it will stun it.
An area that will make compatible objects disintegrate and die immediately when entered. Compatible objects are the player itself, Metbo and Karon.

SW_B.Description: Makes the door open once activated.

SW_A.Description: If Obj_arg0 is set and this switch is used, it will keep the collision validated as long as this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene and opens if the 扉開く part gets executed.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set and SW_A is active, it will synchronize the collision's validity with the switch's state.
Obj_arg0.Name: Collision Mode?

Classes.Notes: A pair of closed doors that can be opened.

An area that causes the player to turn yellow and run significantly faster when entered. This effect remains active while the player is inside the area and slowly wears out when leaving the area again. This is very similar to the boost gained at the start of a Cosmic Race.
A red pepper that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Dash Yoshi. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma to make it swing. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies how shadows are used.
Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Type

Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes to reach the maximum boost. Default is 120.
Obj_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time

Obj_arg0.Description: The time in frames for how long the boost will be active. Default is 300.
Obj_arg0.Name: Boost Time

Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the ring will always rotate towards the player.
Obj_arg3.Name: Turn to Player?

Obj_arg2.Description: Speed boost multiplied by 100. Default is 250.
Obj_arg2.Name: Speed Boost

Classes.Notes: A red ring that causes the player to gain a short speed boost when entered while swimming or flying with the Flying power-up.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg0.Description: The item to be spawned after spinning near it.
Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type

Classes.Notes: A pile of decorative leaves. If the player uses the Spin Attack on it, it can make some items appear.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies what objects this area affects.
Obj_arg0.Name: Death Type

Classes.Notes: An area that can kill the player and compatible objects when entered.

A controller that sets up a separate cast of cutscene objects for use with a superordinate cutscene. This is used to connect a cutscene that is spread across zones. TimeSheetName refers to the set of cutscene config files to be used and DemoName is the proper identifier name for the cutscene. DemoName should match the cutscene's identifier that it belongs to. The actual setup specifications for the individual sheet files will be included on the Luma's Workshop Wiki. Individual objects can be registered by setting their DemoGroupId to this object's l_id.

This controls and registers several special cutscenes for when the player returns to the Starship Mario. The following cutscenes will be registered: ファイルセレクトからの開始 for starting from the file select, ノーマルエンディング後デモ for the normal ending, スター120個エンディング後デモ for collecting all 120 normal Power Stars, ワールドマップからの開始 for returning from a World Map, スター１個目直後のゲームスタート for collecting the first Power Star in Sky Station Galaxy and ゲームオーバー後のデモ for restarting after a Game Over.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after the cutscene ends.

Classes.Notes: A controller that sets up and controls a cutscene. TimeSheetName refers to the set of cutscene config files to be used and DemoName is the proper identifier name for the cutscene. The actual setup specifications for the individual sheet files will be included on the Luma's Workshop Wiki. Most objects can be registered to an individual cutscene by setting their DemoGroupId to the cutscene controller's l_id.

An area that prevents several player components from updating while a cutscene is active. These components include reacting to Onimasu movement, several collision interactions, getting damaged by Karikari, sliding, AreaMove speed up as well as moving object speed up, warping and much much more.

This creates and controls the animated title screen sequence where Mario, Yoshi and the Orange Luma appear on screen. The different objects and models are defined in a file called EntryActorList. Additional animation cameras (CANM) are used for the actual camera movement. The object itself does nothing when placed in a level and is actually controlled by the FileSelector controller.

Obj_arg1.Description: Valid range is 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.
Obj_arg1.Name: Intensity

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether to enable the blurry effect based on special triggers, such as being controlled by bosses.
Obj_arg0.Name: Synchronize with Player?

Obj_arg3.Description: The minimum blur distance range. Default is 8200.
Obj_arg3.Name: Min Blur Distance

Obj_arg2.Description: The maximum blur distance range. Default is 10000.
Obj_arg2.Name: Max Blur Distance

Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what parts of the view should be blurred.
Obj_arg4.Name: Gradient Type

Classes.Notes: An area that applies a blurry effect to the screen when entered by the player.

A red cactus enemy that consists of four body parts, including the head. It can be defeated by hitting its head with a Spin Attack or by stomping it. The individual body parts can be destroyed with a Spin Attack. It usually moves away from the player, but it will try to fling its head on the player to damage them. It always drops six Star Bits when defeated. It can be frozen by the second player's pointer.

SW_B.Description: Activated only while its shell has been fully destroyed. Otherwise, it gets deactivated.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Camera.Description: Uses the camera with the suffix 戦闘開始のうろつき at the start of the boss fight after it hatched.

Classes.Notes: A Piranha Plant boss that resides inside its small egg before the battle starts. The player has to destroy its egg shell to reveal its large weak point. It can be damaged using Ground Pounds and Spin Attacks. Ground Pounding the shell from above will remove the entire shell at once. When its shell has been removed, it will run around in panic. The player has to repeat this procedure again to defeat it. It always damages the player upon contact. It uses two GeneralPos. ベビーディノパックンデモ位置 marks its position during cutscenes. プレイヤーデモ位置（ベビーディノパックン戦） sets the player's position before and after the boss fight as well as when the battle enters the second phase. It will always spawn a Power Star when defeated. This requires a change to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Classes.Notes: A large Piranha Plant boss. Before the battle, it remains inside its shell. In order to defeat it, the player has to fling its tail ball with a Spin Attack four times. It always damages the player upon contact. However, the large tail ball does not hurt the player. In SMG1, it will always spawn a Power Star when defeated. This requires a change to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Classes.Notes: A large flaming Piranha Plant boss. Before the battle, it remains inside its shell. In order to defeat it, the player has to fling its tail ball with a Spin Attack four times. It always damages the player upon contact. However, the large tail ball does not hurt the player unless it's burning. It will sporadically shoot fire balls during the last phase and create fiery trails that burn the player upon contact. It will always spawn a Power Star when defeated. This requires a change to the galaxy's Scenario file.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated when it starts looking for a new position and gets deactivated after it found a new position. Activated by default.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: Specifies the path that it moves on before the battle begins.

Classes.Notes: A large mole boss. In SMG1, he chases a Star Bunny before the actual battle begins. He attacks the player upon contact. The player needs to damage him three times to defeat him. It also creates trails of dirt when it moves around. He is usually underground but can be stunned using a Ground Pound when his head is above the ground. This gives the player a chance to attack him. He uses several GeneralPos. マリオ再セット1 specifies the player's position after the intro cutscene, マリオ再セット specifies the player's position after hitting him and ドドリュウ再セット specifies his reset position after hitting it. In SMG1, it always spawns a Power Star and uses text for the Star Bunny it chases.
An area that prevents Major Burrows (Dodoryu) from entering it when he moves around.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will remain in the air. If this switch gets activated, it will fall down.

Obj_arg1.Description: How long it remains above its original position before it falls down again. Default is 180.
Obj_arg1.Name: Risen Wait Time

Obj_arg0.Description: How far it moves up. Default is 1000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Distance

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the scene execution order for this object.
Obj_arg3.Name: Scene Type

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the shadow volume.

Values.Notes: Use shadow & shake shadow before falling

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type

Obj_arg4.Description: How long it remains on the ground before moving up again. Default is 120.
Obj_arg4.Name: Ground Wait Time

Classes.Notes: A large stone block enemy that raises up in the air and crushes down again after a set amount of time. This defeats the player and some compatible objects immediately. If used during a Quick Comet, it will always move at a faster and fixed speed.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

Obj_arg1.Description: The number of deaths required in the currently selected mission for it to appear. Default is -1 which means it requires SW_APPEAR to appear.
Obj_arg1.Name: Required Deaths

Obj_arg0.Description: The index of the Galaxy's Dreamer%d.pad file to use, where %d is this argument's value.
Obj_arg0.Name: PAD File Index

Classes.Notes: A green TV that displays the player's screen. It can be used to execute some pre-recorded developer gameplay after talking to it which is usually used to teach the player some gameplay elements. The PAD data for it can be found in the pad folder of the Galaxy's Ghost archive. It can use optional text when talked to, however, it will default to the text labeled as DreamerCommon000. It can also generate any object that is linked to it using GeneratorId.

Counts the player's deaths that occur inside this area and stores them in the save data for the currently selected galaxy mission. This number is used to control the appearance of a Cosmic Spirit (SuperDreamer).

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Point_arg0.Description: Specifies the wall drilling action to perform at this point.
Point_arg0.Name: Wall Drill Type

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how it moves along the path.

Values.Notes: Always turn to path's front direction

Obj_arg0.Name: Pose Type

Classes.Notes: A drill-like enemy that moves along a set path. It damages the player upon contact. It can be defeated by stomping, drilling or Ground Pounding it. Furthermore, can be eaten by Yoshi and frozen by the Orange Luma.
Usually, the Spin Drill creates decorative holes in the ground when using it. However, this area prevents this from happening.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It starts the Bound animation when stomped or Ground Pounded. The actual bouncing needs to be specified using floor collision codes. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg7.Description: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.
Obj_arg7.Name: Color Frame

SW_B.Description: This switch activates when Mario exits the pipe.

Obj_arg6.Description: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.
Obj_arg6.Name: Ignore Gravity?

SW_A.Description: If set, the pipe will not be enterable until the switch is activated. EarthenPipeInWater won't show it's water vortex until this switch is activated.

Obj_arg1.Description: The force to push the player upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.
Obj_arg1.Name: Vertical Exit Force

Obj_arg0.Description: The force to push the player forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.
Obj_arg0.Name: Horizontal Exit Force

Obj_arg3.Description: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.
Obj_arg3.Name: Connection ID

Obj_arg2.Description: The pipe's behavior after being entered.

Values.Notes: Eject without warping and spawns Coins
Eject without warping and spawns Star Bits

Obj_arg2.Name: Mode

Obj_arg5.Description: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.
Obj_arg5.Name: Music State

Obj_arg4.Description: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.
Obj_arg4.Name: Music Change

Classes.Notes: A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000.

Obj_arg1.Description: The type of particles to use.
Obj_arg1.Name: Particles Type

Obj_arg0.Description: How the particles are adjusted

Values.Notes: Flower petals (Obj_arg0 has to be set to 0)

Obj_arg0.Name: Change Type

Classes.Notes: An area in which most of the player's dust cloud particles can be replaced with yellow flower petals.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will emit particles only if this switch is activated.

Group.Description: Registers effects of the same object type, but the group is never used for anything.

DemoCast.Description: If used, it will start functioning once its cutscene action gets triggered. In SMG2, it will stop functioning if Obj_arg0 is set.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the object will stop functioning if the cutscene action gets triggered.
Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?

Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 1000 and a far clipping distance of 50.  Furthermore, its clipping center is at (0, 580, 0). The actual particle emitting is also dependent on the object's clipping. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList. The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will emit particles only if this switch is activated.

Group.Description: Registers effects of the same object type, but the group is never used for anything.

DemoCast.Description: If used, it will start functioning once its cutscene action gets triggered. In SMG2, it will stop functioning if Obj_arg0 is set.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the object will stop functioning if the cutscene action gets triggered.
Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?

Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 1000 and a far clipping distance of 50. Furthermore, its clipping center is at (0, 200, 0). The actual particle emitting is also dependent on the object's clipping.  The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList. The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?

Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 2500 and a far clipping distance of 50.  Furthermore, its clipping center is at (0, 200, 0). The actual particle emitting is also dependent on the object's clipping.  The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList. The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?

The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?

Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 1500 and a far clipping distance of 400. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList. The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.
