Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the object will stop functioning if the cutscene action gets triggered.
Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?

Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 500 and a far clipping distance of 50. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList. The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will home on to a higher point on the player's model.
Obj_arg7.Name: Fly Higher?

SW_B.Description: If used, it will only be able to shoot balls while this switch is activated.

Obj_arg1.Description: The delay between shooting individual balls. Default is 90.
Obj_arg1.Name: Delay

Classes.Notes: A yellow nozzle that shoots electrical charge balls that home on to the player. Touching those balls will cause electrical damage to the player. The Orange Luma can destroy the charge balls.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the fence will disappear. The green connector points still remain, though.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it disappear.

Rail.Description: Specifies the shape and points. Each path point becomes a green point.

Obj_arg1.Description: The shadow drop length. Uses Obj_arg2 if that value is bigger.
Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Length

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of individual fences that make up the height. Default is 1.
Obj_arg0.Name: Stack Height

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies what model and color frame to use. Default is 0.
Obj_arg3.Name: Model Type

Obj_arg2.Description: The shadow drop length. Uses Obj_arg1 if this value is smaller.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Obj_arg5.Description: If set, it will use a different sound effect intended to be used with KoopaStatueVomit.
Obj_arg5.Name: Bowser Statue Beam?

Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the shadow's drop direction will match the object's gravity vector and it will recalculate gravity when necessary.
Obj_arg4.Name: Calculate Gravity?

Classes.Notes: An electric barrier that damages the player and compatible objects when touching the electricity or one of the points. The shape is defined by a path. It cannot be destroyed without special triggers.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the fence will disappear. The green connector points still remain, though.

Rail.Description: Specifies the shape and points. Each path point becomes a green point.

Obj_arg1.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 10.
Obj_arg1.Name: Speed

Obj_arg0.Description: How many segments the fence will have. Default is 10.
Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Segments

Obj_arg3.Description: The number of individual fences that make up the height. Default is 1.
Obj_arg3.Name: Stack Height

Obj_arg2.Description: The length of an individual fence segment.
Obj_arg2.Name: Segment Length

Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what model and color frame to use. Default is 0.
Obj_arg4.Name: Model Type

Classes.Notes: An electric barrier that moves on a path. It damages the player and compatible objects when touching the electricity or one of the points. The path defines its shape and it can be split into several smaller segments which also creates some gaps. It cannot be destroyed without special triggers.

Normally, when the player jumps off moving collision, he will gain some extra speed depending on the collision's movement direction. This area restricts the speed at which the player is pushed into the moving direction to a fixed value.

SW_B.Description: If activated, all destroyed crates will reappear and the switches will be deactivated again.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated if all crates have been destroyed during the time limit.

Classes.Notes: A controller that creates and registers several linked wood crates. Individual crates can be linked to this object by setting their GeneratorId to this object's l_id. It activates a switch if all crates have been destroyed.

SW_A.Description: Activated after killing all linked objects.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Appears after killing all linked objects.

Obj_arg1.Description: The delay until the switch gets activated. Default is 0.
Obj_arg1.Name: Activation Delay

Obj_arg0.Description: The Power Star's ID that should be spawned. If set to -1, it will automatically detect the proper Power Star to be spawned.
Obj_arg0.Name: Power Star ID

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the counter layout will be hidden.
Obj_arg2.Name: Hide Counter?

Classes.Notes: A controller that activates a switch once all linked and compatible objects have been killed. Individual objects can be linked to this object by setting their GeneratorId to this object's l_id. ExterminationPowerStar spawns a Power Star after killing all objects. It also uses a counter layout to keep track of killed objects.

Obj_arg0.Description: Valid range until the shadow fades out.
Obj_arg0.Name: Range

Classes.Notes: An area which, when entered, casts a soft circular shadow onto the surface perpendicular to the player.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only be able to shoot its flame while this switch is activated.

Group.Description: Groups several other FirePressureRadiate instances. The one with the longest wait time becomes the "group leader". All instances will start shooting its flame once the group leader is ready.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action makes it stop shooting its flame.

Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames before it starts shooting again. Default is 300.
Obj_arg1.Name: Wait Time

Obj_arg0.Description: The rotation of the cannon in degrees. Default is 0.
Obj_arg0.Name: Cannon Rotation

Obj_arg2.Description: How long it will shoot its flame in frames. Default is 300.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shoot Time

Classes.Notes: A red cannon that periodically shoots a long burning flame that damages the player and compatible enemies upon contact. It cannot be destroyed through any means.
An area that prevents any angled Wall Jumps. Instead, the jumping direction will be directly opposite of the Wall Jumped collision triangle.

Obj_arg0.Description: The speed to launch the player in Rock form at. Default 50.
Obj_arg0.Name: Speed

Classes.Notes:
An area that gives the player a speed boost when entered using the Rock Mushroom.
Requires a valid KCL floor code of 39 (ForceDash).
The direction of the Dash is determined by the rotation of the area. (Boost is on the Z axis)

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes: A variant of SimpleMapObj that gets rendered after most other objects. This is a generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.
A gravity area that revolves around a barrel-shaped planet.

Obj_arg1.Description: Defines how much of the point of the cone will get cut. Starts at the point of the cone, and moves towards the flat bottom of the cone. Default 0.
Obj_arg1.Name: Top Cut Distance

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, the flat surface of the cone will not have gravity.
Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Bottom

Classes.Notes: A gravity area for a cone-shaped planet.

Obj_arg1.Description: Defines which sides on the Y Axis of the cube are active. Default is "Both Sides"
Obj_arg1.Name: Y Axis Faces

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines which sides on the X Axis of the cube are active. Default is "Both Sides"
Obj_arg0.Name: X Axis Faces

Obj_arg2.Description: Defines which sides on the Z Axis of the cube are active. Default is "Both Sides"
Obj_arg2.Name: Z Axis Faces

Classes.Notes: A gravity area for a cube-shaped planet that allows movement on all six faces.

Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the edges of the disk will not have gravity.
Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Edges

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, only the Y+ Side of the disk will have gravity.
Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Bottom

Obj_arg2.Description: The radial degrees that will have gravity. Starts pointing towards X+, and then rotates counter clockwise. Default 360.0.
Obj_arg2.Name: Valid degrees

Classes.Notes: A gravity area for a disk-shaped planet.

Obj_arg1.Description: The type of edges that will be used. Default "Both"
Obj_arg1.Name: Edge Type

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, only the Y+ Side of the disk will have gravity.
Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Bottom

Obj_arg2.Description: Default 0.
Obj_arg2.Name: Disk Radius

Classes.Notes: A gravity area for a torus-shaped planet.

Obj_arg1.Description: Unknown Effects. Default -1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Base Distance Calculation Axis

Obj_arg0.Description: Unknown Effects. Default 2000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Base Distance

Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a spherical range.

Obj_arg1.Description: Unknown Effects. Default -1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Base Distance Calculation Axis

Obj_arg0.Description: Unknown Effects. Default 2000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Base Distance

Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a box range.

Obj_arg1.Description: Unknown Effects. Default -1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Base Distance Calculation Axis

Obj_arg0.Description: Unknown Effects. Default 2000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Base Distance

Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a cylindrical range.
A gravity area that attracts objects towards its origin.

Obj_arg1.Description: The radial degrees that will have gravity. Starts pointing towards X+, and then rotates counter clockwise. Default 360.0.
Obj_arg1.Name: Valid degrees

Obj_arg0.Description: The type of edges that will be used. Default "Both".
Obj_arg0.Name: Edge Type

Classes.Notes: A gravity area that pulls objects towards the lateral surface of the cylinder.

Rail.Description: The path that gravity will use. Pulls mario towards the path line.

Obj_arg0.Description: How many gravity segments to have. Default 20.
Obj_arg0.Name: Segment Count

Classes.Notes: A gravity area that uses a path to define several points of gravity.

SW_A.Description: Remains stationary if the switch is not activated.

Rail.Description: The path points to jump between.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how items should be spawned.
Obj_arg1.Name: Item Type

Obj_arg0.Description: The delay until it starts jumping around.
Obj_arg0.Name: Starting Delay

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.
Obj_arg3.Name: Connect to MapObj?

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will always cycle through all of its points instead of hopping between the two points closest to the player.
Obj_arg2.Name: Pass All Points?

Classes.Notes: A Koopa Troopa that throws hammers to attack the player. These hammers can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives the player an advantage to attack it. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma as well.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when pressing the button.

Obj_arg0.Description: How long the switch will remain activated before it resets again. Default is 300.
Obj_arg0.Name: Timer

Classes.Notes: An unused button that activates a switch for a set amount of time. The button can be activated using most of the player's attacks. After the time runs out, it will reset itself.

Obj_arg7.Description: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.
Obj_arg7.Name: Binder Activation delay

Obj_arg6.Description: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.
Obj_arg6.Name: Bullet Lifetime

Obj_arg1.Description: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Turn Speed Multiplier

Obj_arg0.Description: The range the player has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Homing Activation Range

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.
Obj_arg3.Name: Ignore Gravity?

Obj_arg2.Description: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.
Obj_arg2.Name: Disable Homing)

Obj_arg4.Description: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.
Obj_arg4.Name: Bullet Count

Classes.Notes: A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

Obj_arg2.Description: The type of reflection to use
Obj_arg2.Name: Reflect Type

Classes.Notes: A drill power-up that allows the player to dig through certain dirt upon spinning.

Obj_arg1.Description: The explosion's damage range. Default is 500.
Obj_arg1.Name: Explosion Range

SW_DEAD.Description: Meant to be activated when it gets killed, but this is not possible at all.

Classes.Notes: A land mine that quickly charges and explodes when stepping on its large trigger. It regenerates after a few seconds. The explosion also causes nearby land mines to charge and explode when they are hit by its explosion. It does not get clipped.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will become passive after activating this switch.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will remain passive until this switch gets activated.

Obj_arg1.Description: The speed at which the Topmini are launched from this object.
Obj_arg1.Name: Launch Velocity

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to declare. Useless because the Coins are never spawned.
Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins

Camera.Description: Used when player gets bounced off.

Obj_arg2.Description: Defines the number of Topmini to be spawned. Default is 4.
Obj_arg2.Name: Number of Topmini

Classes.Notes: A green stationary robot enemy with a spring head. It remains in the ground passively before the player approaches it. If the player is nearby, it jumps out of the ground and emits several Topmini. It will keep regenerating Topmini even if the player killed some of them. The player can bounce off its spring head. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. It is not possible to destroy it through any means.
A small bubble of lava that jumps out and back into lava.
A platform that sinks when the player steps on it.

Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of the light to use.
Obj_arg0.Name: Light ID

Classes.Notes: An area that changes lighting when entered.

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines how the player enters the scene.
Obj_arg0.Name: Entrance Type

Camera.Description: The starting camera to be used when spawning at this point.

Classes.Notes: A controller that sets the spawn point for the player at the start of a mission and at Checkpoints. May also be used for other things such as the warp areas on the Comet Observatory. If placed in a generic object placement file, this will create a glitchy clone of the player.
An area that hides Mario's cap when entered.

Obj_arg0.Description: Initial nerve state.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance

Obj_arg2.Description: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.
Obj_arg2.Name: Respawn

Classes.Notes: An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only turn to the player and throw wrenches while this switch is activated.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the wrench that it throws won't be affected by gravity.
Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Wrench Gravity?

Classes.Notes: A mole enemy that hides in its hatch if the player is too far away or too close to it. If the player is nearby, it will come out of its hatch and it will try to attack the player by throwing wrenches at them. It can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit at it or by Ground Pounding nearby. When stunned, it can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. It can be frozen by the second player's pointer. If the stage's name is CannonFleetGalaxy, it will use a greater range in which it can detect the player.

Displays a model of a power-up that cannot be collected. These objects only serve a decorative purpose. Natively, only the Spring, Bee, Boo, Fire, Cloud, Rock and Drill power-ups are supported. Can be registered to Starship Mario events via MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.

Classes.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Rock character. This power-up state allows them to turn into a rolling rock.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated or deactivated whether the specified condition is fulfilled or not.

Obj_arg0.Description: The required power-up state condition to activate the switch.
Obj_arg0.Name: Condition

Classes.Notes: If the player stays inside this area and fulfills the specified conditions (Obj_arg0), it will activate its SW_A switch. If the player leaves the area again or the condition is not met anymore, the switch will be deactivated again. If Obj_arg0 is set to 1, it will check if the player is "in rush". This refers to the state where the player is bound to another object, for example Fluzzard, Rock Mushroom's rolling rock, the Star Ball and more.

An area that extends the player's sensor range to detect items. This allows the player to collect an item while they stand closely behind or in front of it. This depends on the camera's view direction.

An area that adjusts the player's movement direction all the time. Usually, when a camera change occurs, the player will keep walking into the direction the stick was held before the camera changed. This prevents exactly that.

Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will use a smaller collision binder.
Obj_arg7.Name: Use Small Binder?

Obj_arg0.Description: How far the player moves upwards when flinged. Default is 1000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Launch Intensity

Camera.Description: Used when it flings the player upwards.

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies its general behavior.

Values.Notes: Walk around and reset home position when it flings the player up

Obj_arg3.Name: Behavior

Obj_arg4.Description: If set, it can and will drown if it's inside water.
Obj_arg4.Name: Can Drown?

Classes.Notes: A strange duck-like enemy that moves around passively and chases after the player if they are nearby. It will then try to fling the player upwards. It cannot be defeated through any means, but the player can stun it using most attacks. It will always try to return to its initial position if it walks too far away from it. It uses a mirror model. It can be frozen by the second player's pointer.

Obj_arg1.Description: The number of items to spawn.
Obj_arg1.Name: Item Count

Obj_arg0.Description: The kind of item to spawn.
Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type

Classes.Notes: A bubbly plant that bounces the player off when they touch it. It can spawn items when hit by the player. If one of the players touch the plant with their pointer, it will swing around.

SW_B.Description: The object cannot move unless SW_B is activated.

SW_A.Description: Needs research

Point_arg2.Description: How this value acts is based on Point_arg7. -1 = The constant speed the object will rotate at. 1 = The amount of time it takes to complete the rotation (in frames).
Point_arg2.Name: Rotate Speed/Time

Point_arg1.Description: How this value acts is based on Point_arg7. -1 = The constant acceleration speed until the move speed is reached. 1 = Unknown behaviour
Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Speed/Time

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Point_arg0.Description: How this value acts is based on Point_arg7. -1 = The constant speed the object will use until the next point. 1 = The amount of time it takes to reach the next path point (in frames).
Point_arg0.Name: Move Speed/Time

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Point_arg6.Description: The type of rotation to use at this point.

Values.Notes: Finish rotation at the current point
Rotate between the current and next points

Point_arg6.Name: Rotation Type

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Point_arg5.Description: Stop at the current path point and wait the desired time (in frames).
Point_arg5.Name: Wait Time

Point_arg4.Description: The axis of rotation to use
Point_arg4.Name: Rotation Axis

Point_arg3.Description: How much to rotate the object. Relative to the object's current rotation (eg. two path points are set to 180, the outcome is a full 360)
Point_arg3.Name: Rotation Angle

Point_arg7.Description: The type of calculations to perform on Point_arg0, 1, and 2.
Point_arg7.Name: Speed Calculation Type

Rail.Description: If not set, the game will crash when the platform tries to move.

Path_arg2.Description: If set, orange balls will be displayed along the path the object moves along.
Path_arg2.Name: Enable Orange Balls

Classes.Notes:
An object class that uses paths to move and rotate.

It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Normally, when the player falls into a PullBackArea, they won't be returned to the last position on Ice or GlassIce collision. Instead, the game treats several other collision types as safe rescuing positions. However, this area ignores the check for these two collision types so that these collision triangles are treated as proper rescuing positions.

Obj_arg0.Description: The Start ID of the zone to respawn the player at.
Obj_arg0.Name: Spawn Point ID

Classes.Notes: A checkpoint flag used in several galaxies.

Obj_arg1.Description: Time until the rings disappear.
Obj_arg1.Name: Delay

Obj_arg0.Description: The speed at which the radius increases.
Obj_arg0.Name: Speed

Obj_arg2.Description: Color of the rings.
Obj_arg2.Name: Electricity Color

Classes.Notes:
An object that will rotate along it's axis.

It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).
Your typical RotateMoveObjParts, but with additional support for Clipping

SW_A.Description: Activated whenever the player does not get launched.

Rail.Description: Specifies the movement path.

Obj_arg1.Description: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.
Obj_arg1.Name: Enable white color

Obj_arg0.Description: Enables the two spiky rock obstacles.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable rock obstacles

Classes.Notes: Moves on a path. Launches the player into the air once they get in its range. SunakazeKun objects may use two spiky rock obstacles to defend  themselves.
The galaxy fly-in controller that sets up the fly-in path an sequence for a Star mission.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after spinning.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Classes.Notes: A blue screw that can be screwed into its base by using a Spin Attack on it. After that, it will activate a switch. It will be connected to the collision below.

Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.
Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after spinning.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will force the player to jump off the screw after it disappears.
Obj_arg0.Name: Force Jump?

Classes.Notes: A yellow screw that can be removed by using a Spin Attack on it. After that, it will activate a switch and it will try to make the player jump off.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Classes.Notes:
A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and looping particle effect. The UniqueName effect types that can be specified are EffectEmitStart and EffectEmitStart. If the object is called PeachCastleMeteor, it will ignore clipping checks.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes:
A variant of SimpleMapObj that starts the TexChange.btk animation and freezes its frame at 1 once its SW_A gets activated. Like SimpleMapObj, this is a generic map object with a model and collision.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.
The player's running movement will be immediately stopped if they touch a steep surface inside this area.

Obj_arg3.Description: Color of the Star Bits.
Obj_arg3.Name: Color

Obj_arg1.Description: Radius of the Star Bit circle, only used if a path has not been assigned.
Obj_arg1.Name: Circle radius

Obj_arg0.Description: Amount of Star Bits to be distrbuted along the path or circle.
Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Star Bits

Obj_arg3.Description: The color the Star Bits will be.
Obj_arg3.Name: Star Bit Color

Classes.Notes: A Silver Star that is trapped in a bubble. The player usually has to collect five of them to make a Power Star appear.

Obj_arg7.Description: The index of this launch star's path in the internal SpinDriverPathStorage class. This Arg is read by both games but only functions in SMG1.
Obj_arg7.Name: SpinDriverPathStorage Index

SW_A.Description: If set, the Launch Star will be shrunken (and not usable) until the switch is activated.

Obj_arg1.Description: The distance to drop the shadow. Default -1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Drop Distance

Obj_arg0.Description: The amount of time the flight takes to complete (in frames). Default 300.
Obj_arg0.Name: Flight Time

Obj_arg3.Description: The number of Cameras to be read from the camera file.
Obj_arg3.Name: Camera Count

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the Launch Star won't pull the player towards it when they get near.
Obj_arg2.Name: Don't Grab Mario

Obj_arg5.Description: The rotation that the player lands at. (NOTE: Needs further research as the rotation angle seems inconsistent)
Obj_arg5.Name: Landing Rotation

Obj_arg4.Description: If enabled, the usual Launch Star appear jingle will not play.
Obj_arg4.Name: No Appear Jingle

Rail.Description: The path that the player will follow when flying.

Classes.Notes: A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another.

SW_A.Description: The event to trigger when Mario enters the area.

Obj_arg1.Description: If set, turns off SW_A instead of turning it on.
Obj_arg1.Name: Invert Output

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, SW_A will be disabled after leaving the area.
Obj_arg0.Name: Deactivate when area is left?

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, Mario must be on the ground inside the area to activate SW_A.
Obj_arg2.Name: Ground Use Only?

Obj_arg5.Description: If set, requires the player be using a Spin Drill. (This arg is unused in the vanilla game)
Obj_arg5.Name: Spin Drill Use Only?

Obj_arg4.Description: Plays Riddle SFX when activated.
Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX

Classes.Notes: An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, the Star Ball will hold a Purple Coin instead of a Power Star.
Obj_arg0.Name: Holds Purple Coin

Classes.Notes: If the player stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to feed a Hungry Luma with Star Bits. Does not work in SMG2.

If the player enters this area, any TogepinScorer will detect this as a foul. If this happens, the player needs to get out of the area to make the minigame resume. This area has no effect if the player is rolling around using the Rock power-up.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after spinning.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, is has to be screwed into the ground instead.
Obj_arg0.Name: Reverse Direction?

Classes.Notes: A green valve that can be screwed out of its base by using a Spin Attack on it. After that, it will activate a switch. It will be connected to the collision below.

Obj_arg1.Description: Overrides the LOD system by forcing the objects to use this specified LOD mode instead.
Obj_arg1.Name: LOD Mode

Obj_arg0.Description: The ViewGroup of objects that should be rendered.
Obj_arg0.Name: View Group ID

Classes.Notes: When entered by the player, all compatible objects in its ViewGroup will be forced to render.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene. Its cutscene nerve action will make it start moving.

Classes.Notes: A large rotating windmill with four platforms that move along with the windmill's frame. If registered to a cutscene, it will not move until its special cutscene nerve action gets triggered.

Obj_arg0.Description: The pipe's length. Default is 500.
Obj_arg0.Name: Pipe Height

Classes.Notes: A long pipe with a splashing water spout on the top. If the player touches the spout while using the Ice power-up, an ice platform appears. The player can stand on the platform while the power-up is active. If the player goes off the platform or looses their power-up, the platform disappears again. This object does not come with its own collision model.

Obj_arg7.Description: The ID of the Power Star this crate will spawn. (The scenario needs to have it's PowerStarAppearObj set!)
Obj_arg7.Name: Power Star ID

Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, the leftover broken pieces will be hidden.
Obj_arg1.Name: Hide Broken Pieces

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of coins to spawn when broken. Default 1.
Obj_arg0.Name: Coin Count

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, will play a jingle when broken.
Obj_arg3.Name: Play 'Secret Found' Sound

Obj_arg2.Description: The number of coins to spawn when broken. Default 0.
Obj_arg2.Name: Starbit Count

Obj_arg4.Description: If enabled, spawns a 1-UP mushroom when broken.
Obj_arg4.Name: Spawn 1-UP

Classes.Notes: A wooden box that can be destroyed through most attacks. It can spawn various different items.

Rail.Description: Specifies the optional path that it can move on.

Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object, the other Yellow Star Chips and their controller.
Obj_arg0.Name: Yellow Chip Group ID

Obj_arg3.Description: If true, the chip will be placed inside an Air Bubble.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the shadow's drop direction will use the object's gravity vector instead of calculating the shadow direction once.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Calculation

Obj_arg4.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 2000.
Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Length

Classes.Notes: A collectable yellow chip. Usually five of these are linked together by a YellowChipGroup to trigger a switch to spawn another object, for example a Launch Star. It's usually stationary but it can move on a path as well.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when all linked Yellow Star Chips have been collected.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Yellow Star Chips will disappear after activating its SW_APPEAR. Default is -1, which makes the objects appear indefinitely.
Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit

Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object and its Yellow Star Chips.
Obj_arg0.Name: Yellow Chip Group ID

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies what to do with SW_A and the individual chips after reloading the scene, for example after a death.

Values.Notes: Player has to collect items again after reloading the scene
Reactivates SW_A and destroys chips after reloading the scene

Obj_arg3.Name: Re-activation Type

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the range from this object that the player has to be within for the counter layout to be displayed. Default is 2000.
Obj_arg2.Name: Counter Display Range

Classes.Notes: Controls a group of Yellow Star Chips (YellowChip) and activates SW_A once all of them have been collected. It is recommended to have five Yellow Star Chips per group. The group for this object and the individual Yellow Star Chips has to be specified using Obj_arg0. This controller is also responsible for displaying the counter layout at the top of the screen.

A somewhat glitchy object that requires a custom file to be used. It loads the texture from YoshiBlock.arc/YoshiBlock/YoshiBlockTex.bti and it is a simple block that has no specific use. For some reason, it can't be seen in first-person view or during intro camera cutscenes.

Obj_arg1.Description: If checked, the object doesn't cast a shadow.
Obj_arg1.Name: No shadow

Obj_arg0.Description: Possibly changes the animation from "Wait" to "WaitFree" (Needs research)
Obj_arg0.Name: Unknown 0

Classes.Notes: If the player is riding Yoshi when inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Yoshi Grapples.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after displaying the tutorial once.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, this will explain how to shoot projectiles with Yoshi instead.
Obj_arg0.Name: Projectile Tutorial?

Classes.Notes: If the player is riding Yoshi when inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to eat items with Yoshi. If Obj_arg0 is set, it will explain how to shoot projectiles with Yoshi instead, provided that he is carrying a projectile in his mouth.

Obj_arg0.Description: If checked, no Yoshi Egg is spawned, only the nest.
Obj_arg0.Name: No Yoshi Egg

Classes.Notes: Handles spawning and respawning of Yoshi eggs.
An object which can be eatean by Yoshi and releases a Star Bit. If Yoshi eats ten of these, the player will be granted a 1-Up.
If Yoshi is inside this area after the player dismounts him, he will play a special animation where he waves the player goodbye.

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of required hits on the object for it to spawn a coin.
Obj_arg0.Name: Hits Needed For Coin

Classes.Notes: A destroyable snow spike object used by the Yukkina boss.
